snippet: Gov. Jerry Brown will ask a panel of federal judges to extend its year-end deadline to cut the state’s prison population while the states increases rehabilitation programs.
abstract: California Gov Jerry Brown will ask a panel of federal judges to extend its year-end deadline to cut the state’s prison population while the state increases rehabilitation programs meant to bring down the number of former inmates who commit crime after their release.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jerry Brown will ask a panel of federal judges to extend its year-end deadline to cut the state’s prison population while the states increases rehabilitation programs.

headline.main: California: Delay Sought for Cutting Inmates’ Numbers
headline.print_headline: California: Delay Sought For Cutting Inmates’ Numbers
